reviewText:
This game isn't bad, but it isn't great.
Servers can sometimes be incredibly hard to find, and players are sort of scarce, yet this is one of the WAY better play 2 win titles on the steam market. Sniping is incredibly fun and rewarding (Buccaneer is amazing.) and this is way less pay to win than you would think.
Now, sit down.
When you think of free to play, whats the first thing that comes to mind? If you answered microtransactions, you are right.
Well, forget about those. This game balances that out. You can buy guns, but all the guns are balanced in their own way, and each gun is not so godly overpowered that nothing can stop it. You usually can find a strategy. Some things are overpowered, yes, like the thermal wallhack goggles, but they are useful. Back to pay2win, this game isn't that at all. You can buy some guns, you can buy calling cards and backgrounds, costume coins (currency used to buy outfits for your player) and thats pretty much it. No instant buy max rank, nothing like that. This game is far better than games like Blacklight Retribution, and this game actually sucks you in. You must complete that next challenge, that next achivement...
This game has a remarkable hit detection for a free2play shooter, I must mention.
Also, this is coming from a guy who HATES super heroes and the like, while this is literally the ONLY super hero related anything game I will play without being bored.
Besides, who doesn't wanna shoot a few Joker clones?
Also, the wallhack goggles aren't THAT overpowered. Your teammates can see the enemies as well as you, but only for around 15 seconds, overpowered maybe a tiny bit.
Now if you'll excuse me, I need to go shoot some more jokers in the face with a sniper rifle.

reviewText:
Gotham City Impostors is a competitive multiplayer FPS by Monolith Games, which was enough of a selling point for me, despite admittedly not being much of a multiplayer person. Monolith has been responsible for several of my favorite shooters, from Blood to Shogo to F.E.A.R., and that pedigree certainly comes through in this game. Before I continue, let it be known that the most frequent comparison I've seen has been to Call of Duty, which I've never played multiplayer for any length of time.

First off, the game looks great. The technical side of the graphics aren't phenomenal by 2015 standards, but they more than make up for that in aesthetic. The central conceit is that you are playing street gangs made up of groupies of Batman and the Joker, and as such, the character designs convey the appropriate sense of wackiness. This is met by terrific customization, from weapons skins to individual elements of your character's outfit and body type (The latter serves as the class system, with the chick being fast but fragile and the four male types are various grades ranging from slightly heavier to tank) to their voice pitch and speaking accent. The weapon design feels appropriately sloppy, with bottle rocket launchers and so on. The levels are well designed, and almost all based on trashed urban exteriors, so if that's not your thing look elsewhere. Overall, the maps are all terrific and leave a lot of room for different tactics. Overall, the aesthetic design is unparalleled. Between the psychotic character appearances to the terrific little quips that all of the characters throw out, the theme comes together beautifully. It might be silly for some, but it joins Team Fortress 2 as a great parody of the modern competitive FPS, as well as the Batman mythos.

The shooting feels nice, although the short time to kill doesn't leave much room for error and rewards ambushing tactics. The coolest thing this game does for gameplay is the gadgets. These are movement-oriented items that will serve as your movement technique. The characters move much slower than Quake or UT2K4, but with the gadgets, the speed of the game is increased drastically. I like the Rollerskates, which basically make your character move with the speed and floatiness of a older FPS, although with a little bit less control (It can also lead to ridiculous amounts of knife kills). There's the glider, which does exactly what it says on the tin and also allows you to dive bomb enemies. Another nice one is the grappling hook, which lets you latch on to any surface you can shoot with it. There are a number of these, and the levels are designed with loads of elements that allow you to use them to their fullest, like ramps for the skates or grates with updrafts for the glider. You can tell that this was the focus of the game design, and Monolith did it justice.

The free-to-play model is one of the better ones. The initial loadouts are great and levels come in quick. I haven't spent a dime and I've been competitive against people who are much higher levels than me. In fact, for my light character the starter FPS is fantastic and feels terrific. You'll get plenty of coins for ingame purchases just by playing the game with some small skill.

There are two big things that take away from the game, however. First is the ping. Now, at the time of this writing I currently reside in Hawaii, which is hell for connectivity. In Red Orchestra 2, I have between 150-400 ping. Even so, in Team Fortress 2 and Dirty Bomb, both of which I've been playing recently, I can find 60-90 ping servers pretty easily. In GCI, I couldn't tell you a number. The game rates ping with bars, like a cell phone. When I'm lucky, I get two bars, and most of the time, one. What makes this worse is that GCI there is no server browser that I can find. If the game wasn't so fun, the lack of a server browser would be fatal. It is fun, though, so let me move on.

The second big problem is that at this point GCI is functionally a Team Deathmatch game. There are a number of game types, but no one ever seems to be playing them. It's pretty easy to find a decent TDM game, but it can and will get repetitive for long play sessions and it can really screw over compulsive achievement hunters.

All in all, it's free to play and one of the good ones. The mechanics themselves are excellent, and the Team Deathmatch is always good for a laugh. I recommend it, just don't expect much variety in the modes.

reviewText:
Fun, entertaining, laggy...

What I like:
+ Quick and rapid matches
+ Creative weapons, gadgets and items
+ Various weapon and character customization
+ XP system with unlockable content
+ Tons of challenges to complete
+ Multiple game modes
+ No Pay2Win
+ Prize box with random goodness
+ The joke's on you

What I don't like:
- Matchmaking
- Laggy servers
- Cannot create dedicated server
- Cannot choose side (Jokerz or Batmans)
- Most of the game modes are dead
- Short time limit between matches
- Some settings cannot be modified during gameplay (only in main menu)
- Unoptimalized here and there

The gameplay is absolutely entertaining, and a bit addictive. The variety of weapons, mods, gadgets, perks, skins and challenges forces the player to launch the game over and over again. The classic levelling up system is responsible for discovering the various content of the game. When you kill, finish a map or complete a challenge, you gain experience. After you collected enough XP you gain a level and you can unlock new equipment or outfit for your character. The selectable gear is fixed, there are no random items, no pay2win items, so everyone can fight equally (mostly, when there are no Lvl 100+ players on the map).

The matchmaking system could be much better. The system automatically sorts the players into teams (Jokerz or Batmans), and there is no way to switch sides during in-game, so the teams are sometimes quite unbalanced. The time limit before starting the map is pretty annoying. You don't have enough time to review your gear, especially when you unlocked dozens of features, there is no time to see the new options and choose them. Also, besides Team Deathmatch the other game modes are mostly dead, but the TDM alone is enough for having a good time (for a while).

Verdict:
If you like fun FPS, batman, gliding, grappling, skating, shooting, bows, katanas and parrots, this game is for you.

7/10 [Recommended]

reviewText:
A few years have passed and here am I, again playing Gotham City Impostors, but is it as good as I thought before?

Gotham City Impostors was released back in 2012, at the time the reviews of the game were pretty mixed. People praised it for its creativity, but gave it bad scores, because the game was plagued with bugs and connection issues. Basically the game is a fast-pased, arcady shooter similar to a mix between Team Fortress 2 and Call of Duty, with its in-depth gear customization. There are plenty of weapons to choose from, fully customizable with skins and mods, different abilities and gadgets. You can also fully customize your character with different clothes, masks and body types, each with their own advantages and disadvantages. And this is probably the only game where 99% of the stuff can be unlocked FOR FREE... apart from some clothing DLC!

However, Gotham City Impostors, even today, is still plagued by connection issues and over-all bad optimization! I don't remember having these issues before, but playing it again now, I get disconnected every second game I get into. And with the years the player base has really dropped. You can still have a good TD match, but forget the other game modes. Also the developers haven't been active for years, the last DLC dates back to 2012!

In the end I think that everyone should try this game at least once! This is a gem of a F2P game, and trust me, they don't make 'em like this anymore. Try it for yourself, bring awareness to its existance, it doesn't deserve to be left out to die, and it surely shouldn't over a few connection issues.

reviewText:
In general Gotham City Imposters benefits more from it's FTP status then it did as a 15$ game. You level up in this game extremely quickly (I had the set of weapons I use the most within the first hour of gameplay)and it's to it's benefit. You spend most of your unlocks on character customization. This is the main appeal of Gotham City Imposters and what distinguishes it from other contemporary titles.

Otherwise it is just Call of Duty with a stylistic flair to it. Wether that appeals to you or not.

The only downside that drags this title down is how sluggish the matchmaking system is. Regularly I have to wait several minutes to join a match (Just to join) and several more for the game to decide what server to host it on. I feel this game could have greatly benefited from Dedicated Servers as a result.

reviewText:
Its a fun game and all, but the player base is way too small. There are 4 Gamemodes, Deathmatch, Fumigation, Psych Warfare, and Bounty Hunter. Fumigation is simply a form of multi-king-of-the-hill, with 3 points to caputure and hold. Psych Warfare is a similar game mode to 1 flag CTF, the only difference being that once the flag, or in this case, battery, is captured, you have to wait some time before the point counts. Within that time, the oposing team is able to steal it, and try  to get it to their base. When the time is up, the team that failed is disarmed, and has to survive for some time, but can still slap the opposing team. After some more time, the team is rearmed, and the battery resets.

Unfourtantly, as it appears to me, the only active game mode is death match, and even then, its hard to get into a game. I have sat in the other game mode lobbies for hours, and not had a single person join. So, If, youre gonna download this game, expect to only play DeathMatch. Unfourtantly, sometimes even that is nearly empty, and youre lucky to get someone to join.

I'm not gonna lie, this game is extremely fun. the gameplay is well balenced, with a plethora of loadout customization options. That, and you get to be low budget Batman.

reviewText:
8/10

This game is well worth a look for an alternate to Team Fortress, other FPS looking for a comic grace. It doesn't take itself too seriously. Free to Play. Still pretty strong in terms of numbers. Premise is that Batman has left Gotham to groups of mad vigliantes out to rid the city of crime (Batz) dressed up in clothes like him, and criminals the (jokerz) are out to rid havoc.

Pros: Good Selection of Weapons/Classes ranging from your typical shotguns, rifles, snipers to more elaborate ones like Bear Traps, Mr Freeze's Freeze Ray and even a Parrot Launcher. Pretty Well Balanced for Beginners.  Customisation is pretty good. lots of profile options, calling cards etc.   Gadgets are a nice alternative. Gliding, Springed shoes, roller blades, and jetpacks offer different ways of moving around maps.

Cons: Limited number of maps (only 6). Tendency to glitch/lag an awful lot and being kicked for no apparent reason. Only 6 people per game.  Some of the DLC stuff is pretty over-priced.

Leveling is a mixed bag. Achievements can be reached by mixing around different weapons, set ups. Gun gameplays reacts fast enough, easy to pick up with exp of the genre. Only problem is it can take ages to build up a few decent custom load-outs, if you want a varied playstyle.

Team Deathmatch is the best mode, the rest are just variations of capture the flag etc. TM is the only one still really busy.

reviewText:
Gotham City Impostors is a great concept for a multiplayer deathmatch game. Hundreds of insane citizens have either sided with Batman, carrying on the Dark Knight's work during the day with lethal force(!), or attached themselves to the ideals of the Joker, going toe-to-toe with the bats by utilizing rocket launchers and jack-in-the-box explosives. It's manic, to say the least.

The strongest asset of this title is its humor. There are several voices you can choose for your Bat and your Joker, and most of the things they say are absurd enough to elicit some chuckles. The visuals help, giving Gotham an appropriately comic look, with many jokes spread all over the environment. Of course, you'll likely be running and gunning too much to notice, but there are some very clever visual gags in the Amusement Mile and Crime Alley maps, including some great easter eggs for true Batman/DC fans.

The level of customization is impressive. The more you play, the more weapons, support items, costumes, skins, voices, and body types you'll unlock, with others available for purchase as part of specially themed sets. GCI is a free to play game, so there's no need to buy anything, but it's hard to pass up being a Pirate-themed Batman, am I right?

On the downside, the game being free to play means no server support from the studio, which can result in being kicked out of a match if the host quits or their computer has trouble running the scenario. There are also occasional graphical glitches that can disrupt the flow of a game. Renewed interest from the developer and an update or two would be great. Most of the time though, the challenge is just finding enough people playing to put a match together. The community is small, and certain modes such as Fumigation are never able to be played because the only people logged in will be doing Team Deathmatch and nothing else (compare this situation to Team Fortress 2, where you can always find a game in any mode, any time of day).

In the end though, Gotham City Impostors is a lighthearted, simple, and amusing game that's free to play and offers a few laughs. Can't ask for much more than that.

reviewText:
GC Impostors is a multiplayer shooter developed by Monolith and became free-to-play after a year.

Pros:
There are not many levels, but those are well-designed, which is also true when it comes to the characters and weapons. Overally interesting and unique ideas in gameplay. Different gadgets and addons let you play in your own style. Good character progression with plenty to unlock and purchase, even on the 500th level. Visual customization options are nice, you can have your very own look on both sides. Challenges, achievements and feats are expanding the content range. Good humour and theme. I got a lot of packs after my purchase of the original.

Cons:
Terrible lag, performance, server, and other issues making almost impossible to play the game. I cannot play the game even on the lowest settings. Worst game of all time optimization wise. Matchmaking is the same as before, so you might get onto a server where 80% of the players have bad ping. Also, there are server connection losses and other stuff to entertain you if you bored. Only a few game modes and a handful of maps. Some overpowered weapons and gear. With packs purchased through steam better equipment can be obtained early. Content which can only be unlocked via purchase. No actual expansions, maps, weapons, anything added for years. Not many players nowadays.

Overall, after more than 2 years of my purchase I still cannot play the game smoothly. The performance only slightly improved. It is a shame that good ideas were ruined by incompetent optimization.

My Opinion:
OVERALL: 6/10
Graphics: 8/10
Gameplay: 9/10 (core gp without lag and perf issues)
Sound: 8/10
Content: 7/10
Playerbase: 6/10
Port: 3/10

reviewText:
I don't understand the negative reviews I've read because most, if not all were very recent and I've never encpuntered the problems they have. Now I don't want to go in-depth with this review though since I don't want a long review so here's a simple pros/cons (Don't let my profile/username fool you, I tried this out way before I got into Batman/Joker)
Pros:
-Very enjoyable
-Lots of customization
-Lots of different weapons/gadgets to mess around with
-Moderately active community
-Not pay to win (P2W)
-Well-designed maps
-Like TF2 and Arkham Origins Online had a baby, but it only inherited the Batman theme from Arkham Origins
-Friendly community
-Not very rage-inducing

Cons:
-Few maps
-Although not P2W, has a P2W model where you pay for weapons to unlock early on
-Not all items can be bought with in-game currency
-Older, more experienced players have an advantage over new players
-Sniper rifles are OP and you have a slim chance to win in a fight against a speedy or bulky character with one
-Jokerz seem to win more than the Bats (and I ironically end up on Bats, considering my name)
-Prizes usually spawn in an area dominated by a certain team

Overall score: 7/10
I'd recommend this for any Batman fan who also likes TF2 or FPS games

reviewText:
Pretty funny for the few hours that its humour lasts but as an FPS it isn't very good. The branding is doing a good job of attracting customers though.

Pro's:
Humour
Silly weapons and gadgets
Pretty large maps for a multiplayer FPS
Vigilante Batman and Joker impersonators

Cons:
Graphics are a little rough on the eye, but they do follow the games tone.
Humour goes stale in a couple of hours and lines are repeated
Unsatisfying Gunplay
Levelling system
Payed Gun DLC
Not very much replay value

Final Verdict:
A game that will entertain for a few hours but has no major feature that would give it any real replay value unless you enjoy listening to the same comedy lines for hours on end but slightly funny while it lasts

4/10

reviewText:
This is a very enjoyable take on the multiplayer FPS.

Before having played Gotham city imposters i was very familiar to multiplayer FPS games such as call of duty and Battlefield, Gotham City Imposters brings an element of insane to the table.

Adding outrageous attachments for weapons such as a sniffer barrel attachment allowing the player to catch their sent through walls. The overall feel of the game isn’t as smooth as a call of duty game and some parts seem a little bit iffy. I spend most of my time playing team death match simply because the other game modes don’t appeal to me.

At the end of the day I would say it is a fantastic game to have a laugh with your friends.
